co2.pollutant_desc: Carbon dioxide (CO2) is a colorless, odorless gas produced by burning carbon and organic compounds and by respiration. Elevated levels can lead to health issues.

eco2.pollutant_desc: Equivalent CO2 (eCO2) is an estimation of CO2 concentration based on the measurements of other gases. It helps to assess air quality in terms of CO2 levels.

pm1.pollutant_desc: Particulate matter less than 1 micrometer in diameter, PM1.0 can penetrate deeply into the lungs and even enter the bloodstream, posing significant health risks.

pm25.pollutant_desc: Particulate matter less than 2.5 micrometers in diameter, PM2.5 is capable of reaching the respiratory tract and is linked to various cardiovascular and respiratory diseases.

pm10.pollutant_desc: Particulate matter less than 10 micrometers in diameter, PM10 can be inhaled into the lungs but is generally filtered by the upper respiratory system.

formaldehyde.pollutant_desc: Formaldehyde is a colorless, strong-smelling gas used in making building materials and many household products, which can cause irritation and long-term health effects.

pn10.pollutant_desc: Particulate matter that passes through a size-selective inlet with a 50 % efficiency cut-off at 10 μm aerodynamic diameter.

tvoc.pollutant_desc: Total Volatile Organic Compounds (TVOC) are a group of organic chemical compounds that can easily become vapors or gases, affecting indoor air quality and health.

airTemperature.pollutant_desc: Air temperature is a measure of how hot or cold the air in the indoor environment. It affects comfort, health, and indoor air quality.

relativeHumidity.pollutant_desc: Relative humidity is the amount of moisture in the air compared to what the air can 'hold' at that temperature. It affects comfort, health, and the condition of buildings.
